Game.Name: Bull Fight - Ring no Haja (Japan)
Game.plot: Overview:Bullfight Ring no Hasha ("Bullfight Ring of Champions") is a boxing game from Cream exclusive to the PC Engine. The player selects a boxer and a trainer and takes on a series of increasingly tougher opponents. The games uses a horizontal 2D perspective of the ring, except when one of the boxers has been knocked down: the view then changes to a top-down perspective as they struggle to get back up before the ten-count finishes.The game also supports a "survival" tournament mode and a "fighting" mode, which is a side-scrolling brawler where the player character fights through a number of different opponents on the streets. This mode also has power-ups, shops and flying score items that the player has to catch.Cheat: Last Fight PasswordAt the password screen, enter the following Japanese characters (format is Row #, Column #).
Game.Notes: Select your boxer, select your manager and duke it out for the championship. Bullfight takes the conventional side view of many boxing games - you shuffle left and right tapping one button for block and another for punch, the height of which is determined by the D-pad. During the action, commentators chatter away at the bottom of the screen until one of you goes down for good. This is fairly standard stuff, although Bullfight also has an extra fighting mode to add variety. In it, you take to the streets in a Vigilante-style scrolling beat 'em up, stopping at shops to buy equipment on the way to the main fights in a proper arena.
